page.title: 03ANIMAL REFUGE- GATESHEAD
page.content: Robert Bryson was an animal lover who was very distressed when he saw unwanted pets being thrown into a nearby quarry. He went to the quarry, collected the pets and took them home.He found that he had too many, so he bought an old school in 1943 and turned it into an Animal Refuge, run by voluntary helpers. Mr Bryson died in 1983 but his good work still continues.There are now eight paid staff and voluntary workers. Grazing land is loaned free of charge by Gateshead Metropolitan Borough Council.Food for the animals is donated by the public. On the day of our visit,there were one hundred horses,sixty cats, two cows,twenty five dogs,fourteen goats, two sheep, pigeons, doves, budgies, ducks, geese, chickens, rabbits, cockerels and a pig.
